com.mishmash.rally
Class Interpreter

java.lang.Object
  com.mishmash.rally.Interpreter

public class Interpreter
extends java.lang.Object

This class interprets string input from the user and creates cards from that input if possible.

Author:
mrmcduff

Constructor Detail

Interpreter

Method Detail

interpret

public static java.util.List<Card> interpret(java.lang.String line)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Interprets a line of input and returns a set of cars based on that input if it is valid. If it isn't valid, this returns a descriptive string in the form of the thrown IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:
line - The line of input to be read.
Returns:
A list of cards made from the line.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input isn't properly formatted. The exception's description will contain all of the invalid tokens to assist the user in determining what went wrong.

tokenize

public static java.lang.String[] tokenize(java.lang.String rawInput)
Breaks up the line using whitespace, commas, or semicolons as the splitters.

Parameters:
rawInput - The input from the user.
Returns:
An array of String tokens.

getBadFormatTokens

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getBadFormatTokens(java.lang.String[] tokenizedInput)
Finds any badly formatted tokens and returns them.

Parameters:
tokenizedInput - The raw array of tokens from the user.
Returns:
Any tokens that are formatted such that cards cannot be made from them.

convertStringsToCards

public static java.util.List<Card> convertStringsToCards(java.lang.String[] goodTokens,
                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> badCardTokens)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts tokens (that should already have been checked for formatting) into cards if possible.

Parameters:
goodTokens - The set of previously validated tokens.
badCardTokens - A list into which to stuff the tokens that make invalid cards, like the 155 of hearts.
Returns:
A list of cards converted from the input tokens.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the input tokens can't be made into cards.

convertTokenToCard

public static Card convertTokenToCard(java.lang.String token)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts a token to a card if possible. This token should already have been filtered for formatting.

Parameters:
token - The string token to be converted.
Returns:
The card based on the token.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the string is not properly formatted.

getErrorString

public static java.lang.String getErrorString(java.util.List<java.lang.String> badTokens)
Gets a nicely formatted and user-readable error string based on the set of bad tokens provided.

Parameters:
badTokens - A list of strings that can't be interpreted by the interpreter.
Returns:
An error message to display to the user.
